Only get this game, if you want to play Survive with friends. If you want to solo que, or play killer, tough luck. Terrible matching, unbalanced perks. After over a hundred hours of playing both sides, it's clear Behavior loves the survivors more then the killers. Honestly, save your money, don't make the mistake I made and buy this full price.

If you play games competitively, this game is not for you. Both people that want to play just for fun and ranked only have access to a ranked mode (there is no casual play) along with the mass of bugs that can make it infuriating. If you just play this game for the fun of it, with maybe a little ranked on the way, it's actually pretty fun learning the mechanics of some killers and how to play survivor.

Really fun multiplayer game, especially with friends. The game feels pretty well-balanced to me, and I think support for this game is great! The add-on characters are also great, especially the crossover ones like Michael Myers, Leatherface, and the Stranger Things characters. Played more survivor than killer, and this might be a good idea for new players, as it lets you familiarize yourself with the map layouts and game mechanics. Killer is intimidating to learn, but really fun and rewarding when you do well.

Overall great game, would recommend!

This is honestly a really difficult review to write. I truly wish I could give this game a good review.

I initially picked up this game because of a recommendation from someone I am very close with in the summer of 2020. I got hooked, and the entirety of my friend group followed suit. We played survivor as a group for I want to say at least 50 hours if not more, and then I tried to play killer. I got hooked on deathslinger and played him for around three. hundred. and fifty. hours. And then I played 50 hours of blight. I am the person in my friend group that has played the most of this game, and I currently have zero intent on returning to this game.

Initially, what made this game fun was the adrenaline. On both killer and survivor, the energy I got from chases was something I had hardly gotten from anything else. Next, it was the learning- understanding what worked best for the play styles I enjoyed and using such resources to my advantage. After that it was simply my own hubris. My friends said I was the best killer out of the group, and it all went to my head. I had a desire to play this game and win to feel successful and skilled.

The reason I lost interest is an amalgamation of several different reasons. First, off, there are many scenarios where the game does not feel balanced in the slightest. There are certain maps or conditions where it feels like there is absolutely nothing you can do to win. Even if it's a level playing field, there are still going to be mistakes you make that make you feel absolutely worthless even if you win in the end. It's gotten to the point where it's stopped feeling good to win. Not to mention the consistently toxic side of the community that it feels like you can't avoid.

Maybe the issue was how I never stopped to play anything else. Maybe I just don't have the right mindset to play this game at a high level. Maybe I just suck, and my complaints aren't valid. Who knows. All I know is that I have absolutely exhausted my interest in this game. I doubt this interest will ever return.

I can't recommend this game to you.

Oh Dead by Daylight. Where to begin? You know that one neighbor with the absolute shitbox of a car that your swear is held together by duct tape and misery. Well that is what this game is. Its a big ole' glitch with a game embedded in it. The updates take a long while to download, unpack, and install. The community is a depressed group of toxic college dropouts with nothing better to do than make your experience as awful as humanly possible. The dev's are legit deaf or dumb, or both. I don't think they have ever once listened to their community about what they should change. Instead, they take the most enjoyable features of this game and nerf it for literally no reason. Before you play as killer, be sure to read the survivor's hand book for killers or you will learn every toxic roast in the gaming language. I would totally recommend playing this game if you hate yourself or want to hate yourself. P.S. The holiday skins are cool assuming they can get the event rolling before the holiday has already passed.
квутяк и помнити дети эта игва квававая зопа

I'm a big fan of this game because it's a great distillation of what I loved about Left 4 Dead but in a much more anxiety-inducing way. The 4 v 1 gameplay is great and there are several paths to victory for either Survivor or Killer depending on your play-style. Cooperation is extremely important and key to victory as a Survivor, but it is possible (though not recommended) to lone wolf it and win. The only issues I have so far are with matchmaking and how sometimes it takes forever to match as a Survivor during certain portions of the evening, but I don't necessarily fault the game itself for that.

In 2020 hab ich das Spiel so durchgesuchtet, aber mittlerweile ist es nur noch so okay. Das Spiel an sich ist echt gut gemacht und die Geschichten zu den einzelnen Charakteren sind echt spannend. Ich finde es nur schade, dass es im Spiel nicht so viel Abwechslung gibt. Klar, man kann Killer oder Survivor spielen, allerdings wird das nach einiger Zeit etwas eintönig. Und wirklich gruselig war das Spiel auch nur am Anfang. Es macht aber echt viel Spaß, vor allem wenn man es mit Freunden spielt.
